intro: Myzorrhiza hutchinsoniana, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in the early morning. The plant has a climbing habit and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Botanically, it belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species with similar morphological traits.
